page.title: 13HEDGEROW, CHURCH HANBOROUGH
page.content:
We studied a hedgerow at GR 427125 near College Farm. It runs North-South along a path which might have been the old route from Church Hanborough to Eynsham. On the west is a field with cows, and on the east a field of corn. The hedgerow has a line of huge elm stumps, the trees being cut down six years ago because of disease, and there were traces of old wooden fencing and of old barbed wire.
We found common-nettle, red and white head nettle, knotgrass, cow parsley, common spotted orchid, dovesfoot cranesbill, ground ivy, common ivy and ribwort plantain. The dead tree stumps had holes and in one we found a small rabbit. We also found a spider, ladybirds, and a bird.
